i1.name: An Acquired Taste
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Tahm Kench's''' [[basic attack]]s deal {{as|4% of his '''maximum''' health}} as {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}. Against enemy {{tip|champion|champions}} they also apply ''An Acquired Taste'' [[stack]] for 5 seconds, stacking up to 3 times, with the duration refreshing on {{ai|Tongue Lash|Tahm Kench}} and subsequent attacks. The stacks decay once every {{fd|0.67}} seconds when the duration ends.
{{ai|Tongue Lash|Tahm Kench}} and {{ai|Devour|Tahm Kench}} gain additional effects against enemies with 3 stacks.
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Tahm Kench's basic attacks deal 4% of his maximum health as bonus magic damage. Against enemy champions they also apply An Acquired Taste stack for 5 seconds, stacking up to 3 times, with the duration refreshing on Tongue Lash and subsequent attacks. The stacks decay once every 0.67 seconds when the duration ends.
Tongue Lash and Devour gain additional effects against enemies with 3 stacks.
i1.notes:
* By calculating ''An Acquired Taste's'' base damage, using '''Tahm Kench's''' base health, ''An Acquired Taste's'' damage can be acquired in a different way: {{as|{{pp|4/100*({{ccd|Tahm Kench|hp_base}}+{{ccd|Tahm Kench|hp_lvl}}*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1)))}}|magic damage}} {{as|(+ 4% '''bonus''' health)}} {{as|magic damage}}.
* The passive bonus damage applies to turrets.

q1.name: Tongue Lash
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Tahm Kench''' lashes his tongue in the target direction, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to the first enemy hit and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them for 3 seconds.
If an enemy champion is struck while at three {{ai|An Acquired Taste|Tahm Kench}} stacks, they're also {{tip|stun|stunned}} for 2 seconds, consuming all their stacks.

During ''Tongue Lash'', {{ai|Devour|Tahm Kench}} can be cast for no {{sti|mana|{{as|mana}}}} expenditure and cast time to swallow the {{tip|minion}} or non-epic {{tip|monster}} struck after being pulled over {{fd|0.75}} seconds at the cost of no longer dealing ''Tongue Lash's'' damage.
q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Tahm Kench lashes his tongue in the target direction, dealing magic damage to the first enemy hit and slowing them for 3 seconds.
If an enemy champion is struck while at three An Acquired Taste stacks, they're also stunned for 2 seconds, consuming all their stacks.
During Tongue Lash, Devour can be cast for no mana expenditure and cast time to swallow the minion or non-epic monster struck after being pulled over 0.75 seconds at the cost of no longer dealing Tongue Lash's damage.
q1.notes:
* {{ai|Devour|Tahm Kench}} can be 'queued' at any point during ''Tongue Lash'' (including the wind-up animation) and will not go on cooldown if '''Tahm Kench''' fails to hit a valid target with ''Tongue Lash''.
* All three {{ai|An Acquired Taste|Thresh}} stacks will be consumed even if ''Tongue Lash's'' {{tip|stun}} is negated.

effects.str:
• Magic Damage: (+ 70% AP)

  • Slow: %

w1.name: Devour
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Tahm Kench''' swallows the target enemy {{tip|minion}}, non-epic {{tip|monster}} or allied {{tip|champion}} for up to 4 seconds. Swallowed units are rendered {{tip|vanish|vanished}} and cannot perform any actions. If the target is an ally, they become {{tip|displacement immune}} while swallowed. If the target is an enemy, they are instantly {{tip|stun|stunned}} for {{fd|0.5}} seconds and {{tip|suppression|suppressed}} for the cast time and while swallowed.

'''Tahm Kench''' can swallow a target enemy champion for up to 2 seconds if they have three {{ai|An Acquired Taste|Tahm Kench}} stacks, doing so consumes all of them. If '''Tahm Kench''' swallows a champion, he becomes unable to cast movement spells and is {{tip|slow|slowed}} by 95% for the duration.
Swallowing an enemy refunds 50% of ''Devour's'' {{sti|cooldown}} and {{sti|{{as|mana cost}}}}.

After 1 second, ''Devour'' can be recast into {{ai|Regurgitate|Tahm Kench}} while '''Tahm Kench's''' belly is full, and automatically does so at the end of the duration. Allied champions can exit at will by inputting a movement command after the same delay, unless they're {{tip|immobilize|immobilized}}.
w1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Tahm Kench swallows the target enemy minion, non-epic monster or allied champion for up to 4 seconds. Swallowed units are rendered vanished and cannot perform any actions. If the target is an ally, they become displacement immune while swallowed. If the target is an enemy, they are instantly stunned for 0.5 seconds and suppressed for the cast time and while swallowed.
Tahm Kench can swallow a target enemy champion for up to 2 seconds if they have three An Acquired Taste stacks, doing so consumes all of them. If Tahm Kench swallows a champion, he becomes unable to cast movement spells and is slowed by 95% for the duration.
Swallowing an enemy refunds 50% of Devour's cooldown and mana cost.
After 1 second, Devour can be recast into Regurgitate while Tahm Kench's belly is full, and automatically does so at the end of the duration. Allied champions can exit at will by inputting a movement command after the same delay, unless they're immobilized.
w1.notes:
* ''Devour'' does not destroy in-flight {{tip|projectile|projectiles}} for enemy targets.
* ''Devour'' renders enemies {{tip|untargetable}} once they are inside '''Tahm Kench's''' belly. Allies become ''untargetable'' on-cast.
*''Devour'' counts as an ability activation for the purposes of on-cast effects such as {{tip|Spellblade}} and stacking {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}}.
**Detonating the ability early for {{ai|Regurgitate|Tahm Kench}} does not.
* If the displacement of the target entering '''Tahm Kench's''' belly is interrupted, the target is swallowed immediately.
* ''Devour's'' initial {{tip|suppression}} is separate from the one that lasts while swallowed.
** {{tip|Cleanse|Cleansing}} the initial one will also remove the displacement of entering the belly.
* ''Devour'' will remove {{tip|airborne}} effects from the target upon entering '''Tahm Kench's''' belly.
* Swallowed non-champions cannot be reduced below {{sti|{{as|1 health}}}}.
* ''Devour'' cannot be used on allies that are {{tip|channel|channeling}}.
* ''Devour'' cannot be cast on units that are {{tip|displacement immune}}.
* ''Devour'' cannot be cast on {{ai|A Harmless Scarecrow|Fiddlesticks|Effigies}}.
* ''Devour's'' cast will cancel if the target becomes {{tip|displacement immune}} during the cast time. The cooldown will be refunded if this occurs.
** The same also happens if they become {{tip|cc-immune|immune to crowd control}}, although the cooldown is not refunded.
* The swallowed target will become free if '''Tahm Kench''' enters or leaves the {{ai|Realm of Death|Mordekaiser}} or is teleported by {{ai|Realm Warp|Ryze}}.
* '''Tahm Kench''' cannot channel {{si|Recall}} during ''Devour''.
* Swallowed enemy champions will receive ''Regurgitate's'' damage regardless of how they leave '''Tahm Kench's''' belly.
* ''Devour'' is canceled if the target dies or enters the {{ai|Realm of Death|Mordekaiser}} during the cast time. It does not go on {{sti|cooldown}} nor expend {{sti|{{as|mana}}}}.
* The {{tip|slow|self-slow}} is affected by {{tip|slow resist}}.
* ''Devour'' will prioritize champions over other units.
** If champions stay on top of each other it will prioritize those who stay beneath.
* ''Devour'' cannot be used on {{tip|zombie state|post-death forms}} such as {{ai|Glory in Death|Sion}} or on targets that are already being devoured by another '''Tahm Kench'''.
* ''Devour'' cannot be cast on {{cai|Cell Division|Zac|bloblets}}.
* ''Devour'' will not end persistent area-of-effect abilities early (e.g. {{ai|Crowstorm|Fiddlesticks}}, {{ai|Slicing Maelstrom|Kennen}}, {{ai|Inferno Trigger|Samira}}) nor non-channeled ones (e.g. {{ai|Center of the Universe|Aurelion Sol}}).

w2.name: Regurgitate
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Tahm Kench''' {{tip|dash|regurgitates}} the swallowed target a fixed distance in the target direction. If they are an enemy they also take {{as|magic damage}}, capped at 500 against monsters.
Minions and non-epic monsters that are spat forth can collide with an enemy or terrain to deal {{as|magic damage}} to all enemies around them and themselves before taking ''Regurgitate's'' damage.
w2.descriptionHtml:
Active: Tahm Kench regurgitates the swallowed target a fixed distance in the target direction. If they are an enemy they also take magic damage, capped at 500 against monsters.
Minions and non-epic monsters that are spat forth can collide with an enemy or terrain to deal magic damage to all enemies around them and themselves before taking Regurgitate's damage.
leveling: {{st|Magic Damage|{{ap|60 to 240}} {{as|(+ 11% {{as|(+ 2% per 100 AP)}} of target's '''maximum''' health)}}}}
w2.notes:
* Applies {{tip|spell damage}} if the swallowed target was an enemy champion and deals {{tip|area damage}} if the swallowed target was a non-champion.
* ''Regurgitate'' does not count as an ability activation.
* ''Regurgitate'' can send allies to the other side of small walls.
* If ''Regurgitate'' was cast automatically, '''Tahm Kench''' will spit the target in his facing direction.
w2.cost_warn: Wiki's and Riot's mana costs do not match: Wiki's value  0 as 0 and riot's value 100,100,100,100,100 as 100
w2.cooldown_warn: Wiki's and Riot's cooldowns do not match: Wiki's value '0' as '0' and riot's value '20,20,20,20,20' as '20'

effects.str: • Magic Damage: (+ 11% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health)

st_slices: (+ 11% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's '''maximum''' health)

e1.name: Thick Skin
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Tahm Kench''' stores a percentage of the {{tt|post-mitigation damage|Damage calculated after modifiers}} he takes as ''Grey Health'' on his [[health bar]], up to a maximum of {{as|100% of his '''missing''' health}}.

While ''Thick Skin'' is available, and after taking no damage for {{tt|{{fd|2.5}}|Estimated}} seconds, '''Tahm Kench''' {{tt|{{fd|rapidly}}|approx. one tick every 0.8 seconds}}  {{tip|heals}} for {{pp|key=%|30 to 100}} of his ''Grey Health'' over time. Each tick heals for {{pp|12;17;23;30;38;46;55;65;76;88;100;112;125;141;157;173;190;209|1 to 18}}.
{{sbc|Active:}} '''Tahm Kench''' converts his current ''Grey Health'' into a {{tip|shield}} that lasts for 2 seconds.
e1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Tahm Kench stores a percentage of the post-mitigation damage he takes as Grey Health on his health bar, up to a maximum of 100% of his missing health.
While Thick Skin is available, and after taking no damage for 2.5 seconds, Tahm Kench rapidly heals for 30% − 100% (based on level) of his Grey Health over time. Each tick heals for 1 to 18 ‒ undefined.
Active: Tahm Kench converts his current Grey Health into a shield that lasts for 2 seconds.
e1.notes:
* ''Thick Skin'' shield value and ''Grey Health'' percentage heal are both boosted by effects that increase heal and shield power. This means '''Tahm Kench''' can technically heal more than the normal amount of ''Grey Health'' and get a shield bigger than his maximum health.
** At level 18 '''Tahm Kench''' would need {{ap|(1/0.65-1)*100|round=1}}% {{sti|heal power}} to heal for 100% of the damage he takes, reduced to {{ap|(1/(0.65*1.1)-1.05)*100|round=1}}% with {{ri|Revitalize}}, {{ap|(1/(0.65*1.25)-1)*100|round=1}}% with {{ii|Spirit Visage}}, and {{ap|(1/(0.65*1.1*1.25)-1.05)*100|round=1}}% with both.
* ''Grey Health'' converts all post-mitigation damage, ''Thick Skin'' effectively grants ''Tahm Kench'' a form of {{as|true damage}} mitigation.
* ''Grey Health'' can temporarily exceed 100% of his missing health when '''Tahm Kench''' {{tt|heals through other means|Any other source of healing besides Thick Skin}} with a ''Grey Health'' bar at 100%. In that case he will keep the higher ''Grey Health'' value for a few moments until it updates and removes the amount that he healed.

r1.name: Abyssal Voyage
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Tahm Kench''' {{tip|channels}} for up to 6 seconds, highlighting the path to his intended destination to allied champions while opening his maw to offer up to one of them the chance to come with him. ''Abyssal Voyage'' can be recast after {{fd|0.25}} seconds during the channel. If an ally has climbed in, they immediately become {{tip|untargetable}} and '''Tahm Kench''' automatically begins a {{fd|1.65}}-second {{tip|channel}} that, when completed, renders '''Tahm Kench''' also {{tip|untargetable}} and causes him and his ally to {{tip|blink}} to the target location, both becoming unable to perform actions for 1 second and afterwards becoming targetable again.
{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Tahm Kench''' manually begins the channel to {{tip|blink}} to the target location. Allies can still join him while they have the chance during this time.
''Abyssal Voyage'' is put on a 10 second {{sti|cooldown}} if the second channel is not started or is {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}}.

''Allies must be [[combat status|out of combat]] with enemy champions and cannot be affected by their {{tip|crowd control}} effects within the last 5 seconds to come with '''Tahm Kench'''. Abyssal Voyage cannot be cast while {{ai|Devour|Tahm Kench}} is active.''
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Tahm Kench channels for up to 6 seconds, highlighting the path to his intended destination to allied champions while opening his maw to offer up to one of them the chance to come with him. Abyssal Voyage can be recast after 0.25 seconds during the channel. If an ally has climbed in, they immediately become untargetable and Tahm Kench automatically begins a 1.65-second channel that, when completed, renders Tahm Kench also untargetable and causes him and his ally to blink to the target location, both becoming unable to perform actions for 1 second and afterwards becoming targetable again.
Recast: Tahm Kench manually begins the channel to blink to the target location. Allies can still join him while they have the chance during this time.
Abyssal Voyage is put on a 10 second cooldown if the second channel is not started or is interrupted.
Allies must be combat status with enemy champions and cannot be affected by their crowd control effects within the last 5 seconds to come with Tahm Kench. Abyssal Voyage cannot be cast while Devour is active.
r1.notes:
*The initial cast counts as an ability activation for the purposes of on-cast effects such as {{tip|Spellblade}} and stacking {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}}.
**Recasting the ability does not.
* ''Abyssal Voyage'', upon recast, will alert '''Tahm Kench's''' arrival to nearby enemies and allies with a [[ping]].
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Tahm Kench''' is {{tip|channel|channeling}}:
{{ct|channel|cast=false|spells=false|attack=Interrupts the initial channel. Is disabled on the second.|move=Interrupts the initial channel. Is disabled on the second.|consume=false|items=false|interrupts=death, ground, root, silence|damage=true}}
